New Records: Virat Kohli scored an unbeaten 82, the highest individual score in the match.
Key Match Events: India won the match on the last ball with Virat Kohli scoring a six to secure the victory.
Mohammad Nawaz had a poor final over, gifting India two wides and a no-ball which were converted into runs.
Pakistan's top-order collapsed early, with Babar Azam being dismissed for a golden duck.
Pre-Game Insights: The match was crucial for India's progress in the tournament and marked their first game.
Post-Match Reflections: Virat Kohli expressed his disbelief at the victory, calling it one of his best innings for India.
Rohit Sharma praised Kohli's performance and the team's resilience in coming back from a difficult position.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in front of 90,000 fans at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, creating an electric atmosphere.
The article highlighted the intense rivalry and history between India and Pakistan in cricket.
Others: The article detailed the performances of several players, including Hardik Pandya and Mohammad Rizwan.
